events.name: Explosion on Kerch Strait Bridge
events.wd_description: A massive explosion severely damaged the Kerch Strait Bridge, connecting Crimea with mainland Russia, disrupting a key supply route for Russian forces in Ukraine.
events.description: A massive explosion severely damaged the Kerch Strait Bridge, connecting Crimea with mainland Russia, disrupting a key supply route for Russian forces in Ukraine.

events.name: Explosion on Bridge
events.wd_description: An explosion caused part of the roadway on the Kerch Strait Bridge to collapse and ignited a fire on a train of fuel tanks on the adjacent rail section.
events.description: An explosion caused part of the roadway on the Kerch Strait Bridge to collapse and ignited a fire on a train of fuel tanks on the adjacent rail section.

events.name: Structural Damage
events.wd_description: The explosion caused significant damage to the Kerch Strait Bridge, with sections of the roadway collapsing and the rail portion being engulfed in flames.
events.description: The explosion caused significant damage to the Kerch Strait Bridge, with sections of the roadway collapsing and the rail portion being engulfed in flames.

events.name: Russian Government Response
events.wd_description: President Putin ordered a government commission to investigate the explosion and damage to the Kerch Strait Bridge, a crucial supply line for Russian forces.
events.description: President Putin ordered a government commission to investigate the explosion and damage to the Kerch Strait Bridge, a crucial supply line for Russian forces.

events.name: Yevgeny Prigozhin Admits Interference in US Elections
events.wd_label: Yevgeny Prigozhin Admits Interference in US Elections
events.wd_description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, a powerful Russian businessman and ally of President Vladimir Putin, admitted to interfering in US elections on the eve of the midterm vote, a claim acknowledged by the White House.
events.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, a powerful Russian businessman and ally of President Vladimir Putin, admitted to interfering in US elections on the eve of the midterm vote, a claim acknowledged by the White House.

events.name: Prigozhin's Admission
events.wd_description: Yevgeny Prigozhin admitted to interfering in US elections, stating that they have interfered, are interfering, and will continue to interfere.
events.description: Yevgeny Prigozhin admitted to interfering in US elections, stating that they have interfered, are interfering, and will continue to interfere.

events.name: White House Response
events.wd_description: The White House, through spokesperson Karine Jean-Pierre, responded to Prigozhin's remarks, noting that his activities to influence elections are well-documented.
events.description: The White House, through spokesperson Karine Jean-Pierre, responded to Prigozhin's remarks, noting that his activities to influence elections are well-documented.

events.name: Midterm Election Context
events.wd_description: Prigozhin's admission came on the eve of the US midterm elections, in which Republicans are seeking to take control of Congress and state-wide offices.
events.description: Prigozhin's admission came on the eve of the US midterm elections, in which Republicans are seeking to take control of Congress and state-wide offices.

events.name: Ukrainian President Zelensky's Visit to the United States
events.wd_label: Ukrainian President Zelensky's Visit to the United States
events.wd_description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited the United States, urging Congress to see aid to Ukraine as an investment in democracy and securing additional military support, including a Patriot air defense system.
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited the United States, urging Congress to see aid to Ukraine as an investment in democracy and securing additional military support, including a Patriot air defense system.

events.name: Zelensky's Address to Congress
events.wd_description: During his visit to the United States, President Zelensky addressed Congress, emphasizing that aid to Ukraine is not charity but an investment in democracy and seeking continued support.
events.description: During his visit to the United States, President Zelensky addressed Congress, emphasizing that aid to Ukraine is not charity but an investment in democracy and seeking continued support.

events.name: New US Military Aid Package
events.wd_description: The United States announced an additional $1.85 billion in military aid to Ukraine, including a Patriot air defense system to bolster Ukraine's defense against Russian missiles.
events.description: The United States announced an additional $1.85 billion in military aid to Ukraine, including a Patriot air defense system to bolster Ukraine's defense against Russian missiles.

events.name: Concerns from US Republicans
events.wd_description: With Republicans set to take control of the House of Representatives, concerns have been raised about the cost of continued US assistance to Ukraine, which has totaled about $50 billion.
events.description: With Republicans set to take control of the House of Representatives, concerns have been raised about the cost of continued US assistance to Ukraine, which has totaled about $50 billion.

events.name: GM's Expansion of North American Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_label: GM's Expansion of North American Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_description: General Motors plans to expand its North American battery supply chain with roughly 20 deals, aiming to produce 1 million electric vehicles annually by 2025 and narrow the gap with Tesla in EV profitability.
events.description: General Motors plans to expand its North American battery supply chain with roughly 20 deals, aiming to produce 1 million electric vehicles annually by 2025 and narrow the gap with Tesla in EV profitability.

events.name: Battery Supply Chain Expansion
events.wd_description: GM has announced around 20 battery supply chain agreements since May 2021 to support its goal of producing 1 million EVs annually in North America by 2025.
events.description: GM has announced around 20 battery supply chain agreements since May 2021 to support its goal of producing 1 million EVs annually in North America by 2025.

events.name: Ultium LLC Joint Venture
events.wd_description: GM's joint venture with LG Energy Solutions, Ultium LLC, has plans for four North American battery plants to enhance its battery manufacturing network.
events.description: GM's joint venture with LG Energy Solutions, Ultium LLC, has plans for four North American battery plants to enhance its battery manufacturing network.

events.name: Impact of Inflation Reduction Act
events.wd_description: The Inflation Reduction Act's EV tax credits and subsidies support domestic EV manufacturing and tie federal tax credits to North American manufacturing and materials sourcing.
events.description: The Inflation Reduction Act's EV tax credits and subsidies support domestic EV manufacturing and tie federal tax credits to North American manufacturing and materials sourcing.

events.name: Federal Subsidies and Competitive Advantage
events.wd_description: Federal subsidies will help GM and its rivals narrow the cost disadvantage of new North American battery production operations in competition with Chinese battery producers.
events.description: Federal subsidies will help GM and its rivals narrow the cost disadvantage of new North American battery production operations in competition with Chinese battery producers.
